author: cnbc.com
title: Amedisys Closes on Acquisition Adding Coverage Area in Western Kentucky
text:
BATON ROUGE, La., Amedisys, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMED), one of the nation’s leading home healthcare, hospice and personal care companies, announced today that it has acquired the right to operate in 10 counties in western Kentucky from Christian Care Communities.
Under the terms of the agreement, Amedisys acquired the right to operate in six new CON counties and four overlapping counties in the region. These counties will be serviced by established Amedisys agencies in Owensboro and Bowling Green, Kentucky. These agencies earned 4 and 4.5 Stars out of a possible five, respectively, from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid (CMS) for Quality of Patient Care, both above the national average.
“This agreement is exciting because it allows already high-performing care centers to expand their reach, care for more patients and help us continue to grow our home health business,” stated Amedisys President and CEO Paul Kusserow. “I look forward to welcoming these clinicians and patients into the Amedisys family.”

About Amedisys:
Amedisys, Inc. is a leading healthcare at home Company delivering personalized home health, hospice and personal care. Amedisys is focused on delivering the care that is best for our patients, whether that is home-based personal care; recovery and rehabilitation after an operation or injury; care focused on empowering them to manage a chronic disease; or hospice care at the end of life. We partner with 3,000 hospitals and 59,000 physicians nationwide have chosen Amedisys as a partner in post-acute care. Founded in 1982, headquartered in Baton Rouge, LA with an executive office in Nashville, TN, Amedisys is a publicly held company. With more than 17,500 employees, in 426 care centers in 35 states, Amedisys is dedicated to delivering the highest quality of care to the doorsteps of more than 369,000 patients and clients in need every year. For more information about the Company, please visit: www.amedisys.com .
About Christian Care Communities:
Founded in 1884, Christian Care Communities is Kentucky’s largest faith inspired nonprofit provider of senior living, long-term care, and Alzheimer’s disease and dementia support services in 10 counties including these communities: Bowling Green, Corbin, Grayson, Hopkinsville, Nicholasville/Lexington, Louisville, Midway, Owensboro and Taylorsville.
